title: Understanding Prefetch in Web Performance
content: What is the purpose of using `<link rel="prefetch">` in web applications?

options.text: To load resources that may be needed in the future
To defer resource loading until the user interacts
To immediately execute a script when the page loads

explanation: Prefetch allows browsers to fetch resources that may be needed later, improving responsiveness for upcoming interactions.
sampleAnswers: Prefetch helps reduce perceived latency by loading resources before they are needed.

title: Prefetch vs Lazy Loading
content: How does prefetch differ from lazy loading when optimizing resources?
explanation: Prefetch loads resources before they are needed (proactively), while lazy loading loads them only when required (reactively).
sampleAnswers: Prefetching anticipates future needs; lazy loading reacts to user actions or visibility.

title: Webpack Prefetch Magic Comment
content: What is the purpose of adding the `/* webpackPrefetch: true */` comment to a dynamic import?

options.text: To bundle the file immediately into the main chunk
To hint the browser to prefetch the resource during idle time
To force lazy loading of the component

explanation: The magic comment tells Webpack to include a `<link rel='prefetch'>` for the specified chunk, allowing the browser to load it in advance.
sampleAnswers: It hints the browser to prefetch the module, improving perceived load time.

title: Performance Benefit of Prefetch
content: What happens when a prefetched module is requested by the user?

options.text: It is fetched from cache instantly
It delays rendering until all resources are loaded

explanation: Prefetched resources are cached by the browser, allowing instant retrieval when the user requests them.
sampleAnswers: The module loads from cache, minimizing wait time for the user.

title: Prefetching Trade-offs
content: Why should developers avoid excessive use of prefetching?
explanation: Overusing prefetch may waste bandwidth and slow down critical resource loading if prefetched assets are never used.
sampleAnswers: Prefetching too many unused resources can waste network bandwidth and harm performance.

title: When to Prefetch
content: Which is a good scenario to use prefetching in a web application?

options.text: For pages or components the user is likely to visit soon
For every resource in the application
Only for images in the viewport

explanation: Prefetching should be used for predictable user paths to balance performance and bandwidth usage.
sampleAnswers: Prefetch resources users are likely to access next to improve perceived speed.
